sect1.title: Why ctrlproxy?
sect1.para: CtrlProxy is a project I started because running irssi in screen on my server didn't work very well over high latency connections when I was away from home.
The structure of ctrlproxy is very modular and it is easily extendible.

sect1.title: What is ctrlproxy?
sect1.para: Ctrlproxy is a so-called IRC proxy or BNC (bouncer). It keeps a permanent connection to one or more IRC servers. The user can then connect and disconnect his/her IRC client to the bouncer without actually disconnecting from the 'real' IRC server.

listitem.para: Connect to one server with many clients under one nick transparently
Connect to multiple servers using only one process
CTCP support when no client is attached
Transparent detaching and attaching of clients
Direct, inetd-style interfacing with local IRC servers (such as bitlbee)
Responses to queries are only sent to the originator of the query
